Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[A11y]Accessibility fixes 2" (#7939) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Follow-up to https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/7927
Addresses the following issues:
[A11y]Narrator is not reading the labels for "Select Version(s)" drop-down and "Select reason(s)" check-box group #7888
 - Update the descriptions on these to indicate context.

[A11y]The narrator announces same name for all 3 actionable images present under Owner section #7883
 - Updated gravatar image alt text to include username

[A11y]Incorrect name property provided for the "Custom" tab item. #7884
 - Updated descriptions to include proper title.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator is reading out every row in the same table" (#7892) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069968
Screen Reader: 
Narrator
​
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org"
2.Tab till "Packages" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till any existing package and press enter​
4.Tab till "GitHub Usage" section and press enter​ to expand it
5.Turn on scan mode for Narrator using Caps Lock+ Space bar
6.Using 'T' key, navigate to different tables on the page
7.Check if the Narrator is navigating to different rows of the same table on 'T' key press
​
Actual Result:​
On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator is reading out every row in the same table

NOTE: NVDA is working as expected(added attachment for reference)

Expected Result:​
On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator focus should navigate to different tables of the page and not to different rows in same table

Notes:
This seems related to https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7891 in the narrator is seeing tables where there are not any.
I suspect that the rows in the GitHub usage section are being read as tables, either from layout or explicit tags. We should modify this section to look more like the version table below it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Issue loading Credential plugins using NuGet.Credentials" (#8942) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Trying add Azure credentials plugin support to NuKeeper. 
From what I can see the correct? way  is to use   `DefaultCredentialServiceUtility.SetupDefaultCredentialService`

How ever when I do this I get 
```
Problem starting the plugin 'C:\Users\%username%\.nuget\plugins\netcore\CredentialProvider.Microsoft\CredentialProvider.Microsoft.dll'. Cannot start process because a file name has not been provided.
```

And the azuredevops packagesource will continue to return a 401.
I'll include for details below.

NuGet product used:
```
<PackageReference Include="NuGet.Protocol" Version="5.3.0" />
<PackageReference Include="NuGet.Credentials" Version="5.3.0" />
```

OS version:
Win10 v1909 build. 18363.476

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. Use a package source from AzureDevops or other that requires Credential Plugin Auth.

2. Run NuKeeper inspect <ProjectPath>

...

### Sample Project
WIP change to test it https://github.com/eByte23/NuKeeper/commit/0ca5663746a2520e6d41e13e5de06bea2ce8a787

Exact Line
https://github.com/eByte23/NuKeeper/commit/0ca5663746a2520e6d41e13e5de06bea2ce8a787#diff-ec12459316ee7139ad1ac4e840a8f00aR47

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't see the result in the VS Experimental Instance" (#8707) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
@leithmc commented on [Tue Jan 22 2019](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/issues/1276)

I'm trying to add a NuGet package to a project template VSIX so the NuGet installs automatically when someone creates a project from the template. I've followed the steps in this doc, but whenever I hit F5 to test the vsix in the experimental instance it deletes the Packages folder that has my .nupkg file. I've tried adding the packages folder to the vsix project but it still doesn't get included in the build. How are we supposed to verify that our project templates actually load the NuGet content?

---
#### Document Details

⚠ *Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.*

* ID: bbf9be6a-e7b0-b9b6-a3e8-8b5de3c6900d

* Content Source: [docs/visual-studio-extensibility/Visual-Studio-Templates.md](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/blob/master/docs/visual-studio-extensibility/Visual-Studio-Templates.md)
* Product: **nuget**
* GitHub Login: @karann-msft
* Microsoft Alias: **karann**

---

This issue has been automatically marked as stale and closed because it has not had recent activity. Thank you for your contributions.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""version" environment variable improperly used" (#8794) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: ## Details about Problem If one sets the "version" environment variable prior to running `nuget restore` than the restore will fail if the value isn't something like 1.2.3 NuGet product used: NuGet.exe | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe NuGet version: 4.8.1.5435 dotnet.exe --version: 3.0.1 VS version: 16.3.7 OS version: Win10 v1809 (17763.805) Worked before? Unknown ## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem 1. `C:\> set version=foobar` 2. `C:\Users\me\source\repos\my-project> nuget.exe restore` 3. _Error_: ``` C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: The "WriteRestoreGraphTask" task failed unexpectedly. [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: System.ArgumentException: 'foobar' is not a valid version string. [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: Parameter name: value [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: at NuGet.Versioning.NuGetVersion.Parse(String value) [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: at NuGet.Commands.MSBuildRestoreUtility.GetVersion(IMSBuildItem item) [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: at NuGet.Commands.MSBuildRestoreUtility.GetPackageSpec(IEnumerable`1 items) [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext() [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereEnumerableIterator`1.MoveNext() [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: at NuGet.Commands.MSBuildRestoreUtility.GetDependencySpec(IEnumerable`1 items) [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: at NuGet.Build.Tasks.WriteRestoreGraphTask.Execute() [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionHost.Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ITaskExecutionHost.Execute() [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\svt3pbho.qvo.nugetrestore.targets(144,5): error MSB4018: at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskBuilder.d__26.MoveNext() [C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\ulzrrznd.1ke.nugetinputs.targets] ``` **_or_** 2. `C:\Users\me\source\repos\my-project> dotnet restore` 3. _Error_: ``` C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100\NuGet.targets(123,5): error : 'foobar' is not a valid version string. (Parameter 'value') [C:\Users\me\source\repos\my-project\MyProject.sln] ``` **_or_** 2. `C:\> devenv.exe` Then, from package manager console: 3. `PM> Update-Package -Reinstall` 4. _Error_: ``` Update-Package : The operation failed as details for project CSRTests could not be loaded. At line:1 char:1 + Update-Package -Reinstall + ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ + CategoryInfo : NotSpecified: (:) [Update-Package], Exception + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NuGetCmdletUnhandledException,NuGet.PackageManagement.PowerShellCmdlets.UpdatePackageCommand ``` ## Other suggested things Documentation page https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-environment-variables doesn't reflect usage of the "version" environment variable. ### Verbose Logs [foobarlog.txt](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3814825/foobarlog.txt)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PackageReference wild card resolves to non-existent version" (#8411) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

`Wild card package reference version resolves to the 'Version' value passed into msbuild instead of the value in NuGet Feed. I am not sure if this is expected behaviour, can someone please direct me towards documentation if this is expected.
`
NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

```
NuGet.exe
MSBuild.exe
```

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): `5.0.2.5988`
MSBuild version: `Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 16.1.76+g14b0a930a7 for .NET Framework`

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): NA

VS version (if appropriate): `VS Professional 2019 v16.1.5`

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): `Win 10 Pro 1803`

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: `Don't know.`

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Unzip TestProj.zip to get TestProj.csproj

2. Nuget Restore
`nuget restore .\TestProj.csproj`

3. MSBuild the proj
`msbuild .\TestProj.csproj /P:Version=99.99.99`

4. Check dependency version on Nuget Package Explorer
See that the dependency NUnit version is set to the value we were setting for our nupkg instead of resolving to the one in the nuget feed.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22910832/62284647-ea6bf000-b44b-11e9-9f23-ebdac607e3d1.png)

## Other suggested things

### Sample Project
[TestProj.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3456105/TestProj.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Pack fails during AssemblyMetadataExtractor call when NuGet.exe filename is renamed" (#8550) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Using a nuget.exe that is renamed to anything else (eg, nuget5.4.0.exe) causes the `Pack` command to silently fail, and incorrectly create package version 1.0.0.0.

Turns out that [AssemblyMetadataExtractor](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/Commands/ProjectFactory.cs#L776) which calls 

[`return (T)domain.CreateInstanceAndUnwrap(typeof(T).Assembly.FullName, typeof(T).FullName);`](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/Commands/Pack/AssemblyMetadataExtractor.cs#L18)

which uses reflection on the NuGet.CommandLine assembly name.
This is "NuGet", and so if a user changes their NuGet.exe filename, it will throw an exception here, and break the Pack. 

Consider this overload (notice **From**) `domain.CreateInstanceFromAndUnwrap(string assemblyFile, string typeName)`

Oddly, Pack looks like it completes fine. Rather than showing an error, it says that it packed version 1.0.0.0. If you run `-verbosity detailed`, you'll see an inconspicuous error:` Could not load file or assembly 'NuGet, Version=5.4.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.`

Discovered this while trying to repro https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8497

NuGet product used: NuGet.exe
NuGet Version: 5.1.0.6013

VS version (if appropriate): 16.3.0-pre.3.0+29229.4.d16.3 and 15.9.15+28307.812.
Worked before?: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create new C# class library, .NET framework 4.6.2

2. Build the library and pack it.

3. Upgrade the library to a newer version, e.g. 1.0.1

4. Build the library.

5. Rename NuGet.exe to a different name (eg, nuget4.exe).

6. Pack the library

## Expected result
You should now have a package with the new assembly version (eg, 1.0.1).

## Actual result
The output indicates success, even though it did not create the new version of the package. The version is incorrectly 1.0.0.0:
`Id: Repro8497
Version: 1.0.0.0
Authors: <username>
Description: Description
Dependencies:`
...
`Successfully created package 'NuGet.Client\artifacts\NuGet.CommandLine\16.0\bin\Debug\net472\Repro8497.1.0.0.nupkg'.`


## Sample project
[Repro8497.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3575969/Repro8497.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
